util_queue_async_query
[Queue References]

Functions

void * util_queue_async_query (util_queue_t *queue)

Function Documentation

void* util_queue_async_query ( util_queue_t *  queue  ) 

The util_queue_async_query routine can be used by an application to query for a previously inserted object (util_queue_async_insert). If the queue contains at least one object, the object will be removed from the queue list and returned by leaving this routine.

NOTE: The routine returns always the first object inserted in the queue.

NOTE: The operation is not synchronized. There is no guaranty, that the operation will not be interrupted by another process or thread and another object will be inserted at this time. In this case the queue information can be corrupt.

Parameters:
queue Specifies the queue resource.
Returns:
A reference to an object indicates success. NULL indicates an empty queue.
See also:
util_queue_async_insert
